Record.CAVI-Lemma: Fr. of BF band cup. Unattributed. Third quarter sixth. *H. Gropengiesser, CV, Germany 31, pl. 155,2; facs. of Gr. p. 33 (no bibl.).
Record.CAVI-Subject: A: handle zone: parts of a warrior(?) and a man; warrior; two horsemen.
Record.CAVI-Inscriptions: A: handle zone: two nonsense inscriptions, faintly preserved: between the man and the central warrior: six(?) letters. Above the horses' rumps: four(?) letters. On the BG lip, in large and coarsely incised letters, Gr.: [b] [--- αν]εθεκ[ε][/b].
Record.CAVI-Comments: Cartwheel theta in the Gr.

Record.CAVI-Lemma: Fr. of BF band cup. Unattributed. Third quarter sixth. *H. Gropengiesser, CV, Germany 31, pl. 155,2 (no bibl.; see below).
Record.CAVI-Subject: A: handle zone: lower part of a draped figure; a young horseman.
Record.CAVI-Inscriptions: A: handle zone: three nonsense inscriptions: between the horseman and the draped figure: 6 letters. Below the horse: 6 letters. To right of the horseman's back: 3 letters are preserved.
Record.CAVI-Comments: Formerly considered part of Heidelberg S 6a-c but rightly separated by Gropengiesser. It is from another multifigured band cup.

Record.CAVI-Lemma: Fragmentary LM cup [[a band cup, not plain]] From Italy. Unattributed. Third quarter sixth.
Record.CAVI-Subject: No figured decoration.
Record.CAVI-Inscriptions: Handle zone: [[between palmettes:]] A: χαιρε κ[α]ι πιει{1}. B: the same inscription with the same omission{2}.
Record.CAVI-Comments: Foot, bottom, one handle missing.@@[[Diameter: 130.]]
Record.CAVI-Footnotes: {1} so CVA, text; χαιρε can be seen in the photo. {2} so CVA.

Record.CAVI-Collection: Frankfurt, Museum für Vor- und Frühgeschichte B 394.
Record.CAVI-Lemma: Frs. of BF band cup. Unattributed. Third quarter sixth.
Record.CAVI-Inscriptions: A: handle zone: numerous nonsense inscriptions in largish letters, several beginning with epsilon and some being retr. To right of the couch: ειοντ̣. Between the two right dancers: εσ̣ονιοσ, retr. A similar inscription to right of the rightmost dancer, also beginning with epsilon. (The photo shows remains of six inscriptions, some to left of the couch.) B: similar.
Record.CAVI-Comments: Listed in Beazley Archive as `Frankfurt, Historisches Museum', but I assume that the vases there are now in the MusVF. The inscriptions on B are more disjointed and hastier. - For nonsense inscriptions beginning with epsilon see e.g. Munich 2241, with parallels.
Record.AVI-Bibliography: Photos in Beazley Archive. — Xeroxes in Paris at CRCSA. — K. Deppert, CVA Frankfurt 2, Germany 30 (1968), pl. 57,4 (no bibl.).

Record.CAVI-Lemma: Fr. of BF band cup. From Naukratis. Unattributed. Third quarter sixth.
Record.CAVI-Subject: A: battle: horseman; warrior turning back.
Record.CAVI-Inscriptions: A: nonsense: between the figures: five letters. To the warrior's right: two letters before a break. Between his legs: three letters and a break. To right of the horse's buttock: a break followed by one letter.
Record.AVI-Bibliography: W. Lamb, CVA Cambridge 2, Great Britain 11 (1936), pl. 21,29.

Record.CAVI-Lemma: Fr. of BF band cup. From Naukratis. Unattributed. Third quarter sixth. 550-530.
Record.CAVI-Subject: Sphinx. Standing figure and animal foot.
Record.CAVI-Inscriptions: Below, on the black band: --]στρατος+ανεθεκεν+hιερον+τ̣[--].
Record.CAVI-Comments: A modern forgery. This inscription was made in the late 19th century by the forger of graffiti described by Corbett–Woodhead (1955), 251ff.
Record.AVI-Bibliography: W. Lamb, CVA Cambridge 2, Great Britain 11 (1936), pl. 20,7.

Record.CAVI-Lemma: Fragmentary BF band cup. Amasis Painter. Third quarter sixth. 550-540.
Record.CAVI-Subject: A-B: Amazonomachy with Heracles.
Record.CAVI-Inscriptions: Under one handle, on the bowl between the handle roots: Αμασις. The other handle, missing, may have had the rest of the signature in the same position.
Record.CAVI-Comments: The position of the signature occurs on other many-figured band cups: London B 400 (Glaukytes), Munich 2243 (Glaukytes; Archikles), London, ex E 4 (`Thypheithides'); but they are written in two lines. For the dates of the Amasis signatures, see Isler who dates them later than is generally thought.

Record.CAVI-Lemma: Fr. of BF band cup. From Naukratis. Unattributed. Third quarter sixth.
Record.CAVI-Subject: A: handle zone: battle: chariot horses; fallen warrior; leg of one to left; of another to right.
Record.CAVI-Inscriptions: A: handle zone: filling the space, nonsense: εσι. πυ. κοπσ{1}.
Record.CAVI-Comments: From a multifigured cup.
Record.CAVI-Footnotes: {1} so Beazley and Payne. Photo: εσιγς. ικοπσ. I am not sure the inscriptions are complete.
Record.AVI-Bibliography: Photo in Beazley Archive. — Beazley–Payne (1929), 269/53, pl. 15,30.

Decoration.Decoration-Description: RETURN OF HEPHAISTOS (?), SATYR WITH OINOCHOE (?)

Record.CAVI-Lemma: Fr. of BF band cup. From Naukratis. Unattributed. Third quarter sixth. Mid-sixth (Beazley–Payne).
Record.CAVI-Subject: A: Return of Hephaestus: part of a donkey fondled by a satyr (face frontal).
Record.CAVI-Comments: Is this possibly the beginning of a name: Κ(λ)[ετιας εποιεσεν](?). Or, with an incomplete alpha: κ(α)[λος]? The lambda is of `Argive' shape.
Record.AVI-Bibliography: Photo in Beazley Archive. — Beazley–Payne (1929), 269/52, pl. 16,9.

Record.CAVI-Lemma: Fr. of BF band cup. Unattributed. 540-530 (Heesen).
Record.CAVI-Subject: A: part of BG lip; handle zone: at left, trace of draped figure to left; upper part of another to left; part of horse's head to left.
Record.CAVI-Inscriptions: A: handle zone: along the back of the leftmost figure, downward and slightly curved: nonsense: imitation inscription: five dots. Under the horse's mouth are said to be more dots, but the picture shows some rather thick smudges.
Record.CAVI-Comments: Ex Arndt (no. 8119) and Scheurleer collections; acquired 1934.
Record.AVI-Bibliography: P. Heesen, CVA Amsterdam 2, Netherlands 8 (1996), pl. 115.3 (shows inscription(s)) (no bibl.).

Publication-Record.Reference: AMSTERDAM, ALLARD PIERSON MUSEUM 2 ~ , 78, FIG.37, PL.(417) 108.4

Decoration.Decoration-Description: SATYR RUNNING WITH DRINKING HORN, MAENAD

Record.CAVI-Lemma: Fr. of BF band cup. Unattributed. Ca. 540 (Heesen).
Record.CAVI-Subject: A: handle zone: a masturbating satyr to right.
Record.CAVI-Inscriptions: A: handle zone: on his left, traces of a horizontal inscription (P. H. says, two letters of an imitation inscription).
Record.CAVI-Comments: Acquired 1994 in the German market. - I note that the fr. does not preserve any part of the lip; identification as a band cup is no doubt assisted by the location of the picture with inscription, common on band cups. CVA, p. 69, has a full discussion of masturbating humans and satyrs.
Record.AVI-Bibliography: P. Heesen, CVA Amsterdam 2, Netherlands 8 (1996), pl. 192,4 (shows inscription) (no bibl.).

Record.CAVI-Lemma: Fr. of BF band cup. From Athens, Agora Q 13-14:1 (L). Unattributed. Third quarter sixth. Ca. 550-530 (Moore–Pease).
Record.CAVI-Subject: A: no figured decoration preserved: handle zone only, with a bit of lip and of the BG area below.
Record.CAVI-Inscriptions: A: handle zone: nonsense: [--]οεμσοχα̣[--]{1}.
Record.CAVI-Comments: Large and coarse script. Was there a sense model for this inscription?
Record.CAVI-Footnotes: {1} the last letter from the sketch on p. 303, not visible in photo.; it could be gamma.

Publication.Publication-Name: The Athenian Agora, Results of Excavations conducted by the American School of Classical Studies at Athens

Record.CAVI-Lemma: Fr. of BF band cup. From Athens, Agora. Unattributed. Third quarter sixth. Ca. 550-530 (Moore–Pease).
Record.CAVI-Subject: No figured decoration preserved: lower part of lip and upper part of handle zone.
Record.CAVI-Inscriptions: Nonsense? A: handle zone: [---]γ̣ε̣τισφε̣[---].
Record.CAVI-Comments: Unclear whether nonsense or sense. The letters are fairly large and archaic looking. The lower parts of all the letters are missing, but all except the first are unambiguous. Is [--- εαν] δ̣ε τις φε̣[ρει ---] too.

Publication.Publication-Name: Vierneisel, K., and Kaeser, B. (eds.), Kunst der Schale, Kultur des Trinkens (Munich, 1990)

Publication.Publication-Name: Vierneisel, K., and Kaeser, B. (eds.), Kunst der Schale, Kultur des Trinkens (Munich, 1990)

Record.CAVI-Lemma: Fragmentary BF band cup. Painter of Nikosia Olpe (Cahn, Fellmann). Third quarter sixth.
Record.CAVI-Inscriptions: Handle zone: A and B: nonsense: rows of dots or blobs related to some of the figures: A: pl. 22,2 shows one row, diagonally downward from the horse's crotch, and another, similar, below the neck. At left, the photo shows a long downward row of dots to right of the left-hand warrior. B: pl. 22,6 shows a longish row in the same position as the second inscription on A. Pl. 22,7 shows another row behind a rider's back.
Record.CAVI-Comments: + five frs. in Erlangen. A large (`parade') cup.
Record.AVI-Bibliography: Grünhagen (1948), 7 and 43, no. I 850 (Erlangen frs.). — B. Fellmann, CVA Munich 11, Germany 57 (1989), pls. 21,1-3 and 22,1-8, Beilage 5,1.

Collection.Collection-Name: Rome, Mus. Naz. Etrusco di Villa Giulia

Publication.Publication-Name: Hannestad, L., The Castellani Fragments in the Villa Giulia, Athenian black-figure, Volume 1 (Aarhus, 1989)

Publication-Record.Reference: BRUSSELS, MUSEES ROYAUX D'ART ET D'HISTOIRE (CINQUANTENAIRE) 3, III.H.E.20, PL.(121) 27.13

Publication.Publication-Name: Carpenter, T.H., with Mannack, T. and Mendonca, M., Beazley Addenda, 2nd edition (Oxford, 1989)

Record.CAVI-Lemma: Frs. of BF band cup. From Chiusi (perhaps; so stated for Heidelberg fr.). Near vases with the signature of Sakonides{1}. Third quarter sixth. 550-540 (Hannestad).
Record.CAVI-Subject: Handle zone: A: youths and women, with horsemen. B: Heidelberg frs.: arming.
Record.CAVI-Inscriptions: A: nonsense: imitation, but mostly resembling real letters, vertical between figures but also near heads of horses and humans. The letters are largish and seem to be in good part real letters, although some are imitation. I see a good many lambda's, some sideways, tau's, and some chi's (perhaps the same letter?); also some u-shaped digammas{2}. B: {3} .
Record.CAVI-Comments: + Amsterdam 2144 (now in Heidelberg) + Heidelberg S 6a-c + Villa Giulia 79,591 (3 frs.). For the combination of frs. see Add.[2] 49, top, and bibl. there; also Heesen in CVA, Netherlands 8, Gropengiesser in CVA, Heidelberg 4, and ABV 172, not all of which list all the frs. The Amsterdam fr. ex Hauser, Arndt and Scheurleer collections. Brussels R 430y and Amsterdam 2144 are not in ABV. - A multifigured band cup. Problem of whether this is the hand of Sakonides: see AttScr. - A multifigured band cup.
Record.CAVI-Footnotes: {1} ABV 172 (considering only Brussels R 430x and one Heidelberg fr.): near group II of vases signed Sakonides as painter, but "a finer piece". Near two vases, one of which is signed by Sakonides and Kaulos, but a finer piece (Beazley). {2} long discussion in Hannestad. The ph. in CVA, Netherlands 8, is not clear and many inscriptions are obscure. {3} my notes are unclear whether B, which exists apparently only in Heidelberg, shows inscriptions; it surely must have been inscribed.
Record.AVI-Bibliography: F. Mayence, CVA Brussels 1, Belgium 1 (1926), pl. 27,13. — ABV (1956), 172 (Brussels R 430x and Heidelberg S6). — H. Gropengiesser, CVA Heidelberg 4, Germany 31 (1970), pl. 155,1,3-6. — Brijder (1974), 105-109, figs. 1-5. — Brijder (1975), 164. — Add.[2] (1989), 49 (adds Brussels 430y and Amsterdam 2144). — Hannestad (1989), 19/143, 86, 143 and 161 (photos); she has a reconstruction of the cup on p. 161 which does not include the Amsterdam fr. — AttScr (1990), no. 260 (ref. to Brussels R 430x). — P. Heesen, CVA Amsterdam 2, Netherlands 8 (1996), pl. 101,7 (composite ph. of all frs.; inscriptions are shown) (bibl.).

Publication.Publication-Name: Carpenter, T.H., with Mannack, T. and Mendonca, M., Beazley Addenda, 2nd edition (Oxford, 1989)

Record.CAVI-Lemma: Fr. of band cup. Unattributed. Sokles, potter. Mid-sixth. Ca. 550.
Record.CAVI-Subject: No figure work preserved, only the inscription.
Record.CAVI-Inscriptions: Handle zone: Σοκλες επ[οιεσεν].
Record.CAVI-Comments: Berlin West. There is now a Sokles Painter: see Para. 72. Good letters.

Decoration.Decoration-Description: DRAPED YOUTHS WITH SPEARS, WOMAN (ONLOOKERS) WARRIOR

Publication-Record.Reference: GOTTINGEN, ARCHAOLOGISCHES INSTITUT DER UNIVERSITAT 3 ~ , 120-121, FIG.19, BEILAGE 14.2, PL.(4367) 68.7

Record.CAVI-Lemma: Fragmentary plain band cup. Tleson Painter. Tleson, potter. Third quarter sixth.
Record.CAVI-Subject: No figured decoration.
Record.CAVI-Inscriptions: Τλεσον hο Nεαρχο εποιεσεν{2}.
Record.CAVI-Footnotes: {1} J. does not mention the number. I hope my identification is correct. {2} so Jacobsthal, but in the common Greek form.

Record.CAVI-Lemma: Fr. of band cup. From Naukratis. Unattributed{1}. Third quarter sixth.
Record.CAVI-Subject: No subject preserved.
Record.CAVI-Inscriptions: In the handle zone: --.]ες εποιεσε[---?].
Record.CAVI-Comments: I saw a trace of a letter preceding -ες in the photograph, not mentioned by Beazley. - Attic with four-stroke sigma.
Record.AVI-Bibliography: Photo. — Prins de Jong (1925), pl. 3, 4. — ABV (1956), 186, bottom.

Publication.Publication-Name: Carpenter, T.H., with Mannack, T. and Mendonca, M., Beazley Addenda, 2nd edition (Oxford, 1989)

Decoration.Decoration-Description: YOUTH IN CHITONISKOS WITH SWORD, HORSE OR CENTAUR, FIGURE WITH SPEAR

Record.CAVI-Lemma: Fr. of BF band cup. From Naukratis. Unattributed{1}. Third quarter sixth.
Record.CAVI-Subject: A: youth, horse or centaur(2); at left, spear-staff of onlooker.
Record.CAVI-Inscriptions: A: behind the youth's back: four dots. To right of his face: three dots.
Record.CAVI-Footnotes: {1} close to a cup compared to the Group of Villa Giulia 3559. {2} so Beazley; I think he means youth and horse, or a centaur.
Record.AVI-Bibliography: W. Lamb, CVA Cambridge 2, Great Britain 11 (1936), pl. 21,30. — ABV (1956), 196. — Add.[2] (1989), 53.

Decoration.Decoration-Description: DRAPED MAN SEATED WITH SPEAR, WOMAN
WHIRLIGIG OF LION AND GRIFFIN PROTOMAI

Publication.Publication-Name: Carpenter, T.H., with Mannack, T. and Mendonca, M., Beazley Addenda, 2nd edition (Oxford, 1989)
Tsingarida, A. (ed.), Shapes and Uses of Greek Vases (7th-4th centuries B.C.), Proceedings of the Symposium held at the Universite Libre de Bruxelles, 27-29 April 2006 (Brussels, 2009)
Heilmeyer, W-D. et al., Antikenmuseum Berlin, Die ausgestellten Werke (Berlin, 1988)
Carpenter, T.H., with Mannack, T. and Mendonca, M., Beazley Addenda, 2nd edition (Oxford, 1989)
Carpenter, T.H., with Mannack, T. and Mendonca, M., Beazley Addenda, 2nd edition (Oxford, 1989)

Record.CAVI-Lemma: Fr. of BF band cup. From Tariverde near Istros. Unattributed. Third quarter sixth.
Record.CAVI-Subject: A: handle zone: top of a wing; a break; part of a siren's head; wings.
Record.CAVI-Inscriptions: A: on the black band above, in one line: Grr.: Πυργιον κ[αλος] Σακονιδει δοκις. Πυργιον κ[αλος Σακονιδει δοκις].
Record.CAVI-Comments: Beazley's restoration; he takes the second iota of Σακονιδει to be a sigma corrected to an iota; δοκεις may have been written correctly in the missing part; the style of the drawing is not the same as on vases signed by the painter Sakonides. For δοκις see Threatte (1996), 511-512 with ref. to i, p. 191 (iota for epsilon iota). But the intended form may be δοκει. Attic alphabet. The Gr. is apparently written by an Athenian (Sakonides is not the vase painter Sakonides).

Publication.Publication-Name: Flashar, M. and Wohlfeil, J. (eds.), Adolf Furtwängler der Archäologe, Schriften der Archäologischen Sammlung Freiburg (Munich, 2003)
Carpenter, T.H., with Mannack, T. and Mendonca, M., Beazley Addenda, 2nd edition (Oxford, 1989)
Bol, P., Frankfurt am Main, Liebieghaus: Führer durch die Sammlungen, Antike Kunst (Frankfurt, 1980)

Record.CAVI-Lemma: Fr. of band cup. Unattributed. Third quarter sixth.
Record.CAVI-Subject: Subject, if any, not mentioned.
Record.CAVI-Inscriptions: Handle zone(?): [--]αμας, retr.{1}.
Record.CAVI-Comments: Beazley seems to consider this a possible kalos-name. It could be part of an inscription on either side of a lost picture in the handle zone: [--]αμας and [καλος]. But it could also be part of a signature, although no such potter or painter is known.
